an italian expert studying a first century document written by the roman historian marcus velleius paterculus that was recently discovered in the archives of the found what is presumed to be the first eyewitness account ever recorded of a miracle of jesus the author describes a scene that he allegedly in which a prophet and teacher that he names de resuscitated a stillborn boy and handed him back to his historian and archivist ignazio perrucci was hired by the vatican authorities in 2012 to sort analyze and classify some 6000 ancient documents that had been uncovered in the gigantic archive he was already very excited when he noticed that the author of the text was the famous roman historian velleius but he was completely stunned when he realized the nature of the professor perrucci found the text in the archives of the vatican while searching amongst a bundle of personal letters and other trivial documents dating from the roman the text as a whole is a narrative of the return journey from parthia to rome that occurred in 31 ad recorded in a highly rhetorical style of four sheets of he describes many different episodes taking place during his trip like a a violent sandstorm in mesopotamia and visit to a temple in melitta day mdina in the part of the text that really caught attention is an episode taking place in the city of sebaste modern day nablus in the west the author first describes the arrival of a great leader in the town with a group of disciples and followers causing many of the lower class people from neighbouring villages to gather around according to velleius that great name was de nazarenus a translation of hebrew name yeshua upon entering town jesus would have visited the house of a woman named elisheba who had just given birth to a stillborn jesus picked up the dead child and uttered a prayer in aramaic to the heavens which unfortunately the author describes as meaning to the surprise and amazement the baby came back to life almost immediately crying and squirming like a healthy marcus velleius paterculus being a roman officer of campanian origins seems to perceive jesus christ as a great doctor and miracle man without associating him in any way to the jewish concept of many tests and analysis have been realized over the last weeks to determine the authenticity of the the composition of the parchment and ink the literary style and handwriting have all been carefully scrutinized and were considered to be entirely the dating analysis also revealed that the sheepskin parchment on which the text is written does indeed date from the 1st century of this era more precisely from between this new text from an author known for his reliability brings a brand new perspective on the life of the historical character that is jesus of it comes to confirm the gospels on the facts that he was known for accomplishing miracles and that his sheer presence in a town was enough to attract crowds of a complete and official translation of the document should be made available online in many different languages over the next few weeks but the impact of the discovery is already felt in the scientific many scholars have was intriguing to asteroid watchers including the scientists at the project which tweeted the second serious impact in as many years that was undetected nasa officials though are skeptical that the reported explosion and crater near airport was caused by a space on tuesday the twitter feed was reporting that it pointed to an article by bill cooke lead for meteoroid environment office who wrote on the blog that someone would have surely seen the meteor streaking toward managua which has a population of more than 2 the lack of fireball reports from the surrounding populated area seems to suggest some other the skies were partially clear and an object capable of producing a crater this large would have also generated a very bright fireball than the full that should have been seen over a wide steve larson of catalina sky survey said the managua explosion was also out of sync with the passage of asteroid 2014 rc which was first spotted and observed by the sky telescopes on mount lemmon on the asteroid made its closest approach on sunday at tucson the managua impact was reported 13 hours before then larson it would have been a good story if rich kowalski the catalina sky survey astronomer who found 2014rc had previously spotted two other small objects that later struck earth in 2008 and again last no one else has done that and this would have been his third at where scientists are planning a nasa mission to capture and return pieces of an asteroid they have named bennu asteroids that could turn into meteorites are big in addition to bringing back pristine space rocks the mission also promises to increase scientific knowledge of asteroids and the impacts of various forces on their trajectory good things to know should we ever need to defend ourselves from a predicted dante lauretta principal investigator for said the first tweet about the managua impact was a little embarrassing but was quickly countered by skeptical he said the mission wants to be immediate and newsy with its social media but also needs to apply scientific

parents who have the money to pay for treatment for their critically ill daughter have gone onto the street to try and raise the money by selling their son who is the mum meng xiangyan 29 said that she and husband loved both of their children but with certain death awaiting their daughter unless they could get medical treatment they were prepared to sell their son to a good home so that both would have a chance of pictures published in local media show her standing on weihai road in qingdao which is a major city in eastern shandong province eastern china with a placard offering to sell him to the highest he was eating what appeared to be candied fruit and standing alongside his mother as she appealed for someone to come forward and buy the she until a year ago we had a wonderful family and we thought we had everything we could need with a wonderful little boy and a wonderful little girl who are all that changed when my daughter was diagnosed as suffering from leukaemia in august of last year and we spent all of our savings and borrowed everything we could from friends and it still enough and now we are hoping to raise cash from the sale of our medics say that the child is suffering from acute lymphoblastic leukemia and needs urgent medical treatment that includes chemotherapy every 10 days at the rizhao municipal the family have sold up their apartment and everything in it and are now living in a tiny 10 square metre flat close to where the therapies are being carried the parents are also struggling to heat the tiny apartment which is vital to prevent the child weakened by chemotherapy from suffering in the cold which could be their attempt to sell their son follows on from a similar story only recently in which a woman was spotted trying to sell her baby daughter on the streets of china in order to pay her medical ni qiong was photographed roadside in fuzhou southeastern china with a written sign imploring pedestrians to purchase her she and her husband zhou xinggui are both migrant workers but he is currently in hospital needing surgery after falling off despite remaining on the street for four hours no pedestrians offered to purchase her his sign buy my my husband is waiting for surgery fees in the hospital as his boss ran i would like to sell my daughter and save my according to magazines she was also in possession of another poster that fled after industrial accident and we have the money for willing to sell my child to save her many locals who witnessed her in distress were sympathetic to her although some gave her money offered to purchase her daughter in the four hours she sat in the street with the sign the magazine

a set of artist 9to5mac offers a look at retina macbook the renditions and details shared in the report are consistent with previous reports on the although plans do sometimes change during the development as previously described in rumors the next macbook air will have roughly the same footprint as the current model but include a display nestled inside narrower the keyboard will also extend from edge to edge while the speakers move to a set of grilles above the comparison of retina macbook air with current macbook air as part of effort to reduce the thickness of the macbook air the new model will do away with nearly all of the ports currently found on the machine including the usual usb and magsafe instead the sides will include only a headphone jack a pair of microphones and a usb port that appears set to handle both connectivity and new retina macbook air is expected to run on new broadwell core m to allow for the thin fanless design and perhaps come in multiple color options similar to the iphone and ipad the machine has been rumored to be entering production as soon as this month although it is unclear whether apple may wait until its worldwide developers conference in june to launch the device or introduce it earlier in the related retina macbook

officials friday announced they had agreed to a with boko but their statements left confusion over the fate of 219 schoolgirls kidnapped by the militant group in defense chief of staff alex badeh announced the truce saying all nigerian military units had been instructed to abide by the women attend a demonstration in lagos nigeria calling on the government to rescue schoolgirls kidnapped by the radical islamist group boko hassan tukur an aide to nigerian president goodluck jonathan said there was also an agreement for the release of the captive girls following talks with boko haram representatives mediated by officials from chad new agencies but nigerian defense ministry spokesman chris olukolade said the release was still under negotiation the associated press nigerian officials commented on what was being offered to boko haram in return for the the group has previously demanded the release of prisoners as a condition for freeing the military announced months ago it knew the location of the girls but said it would not launch a military operation to recover them because of the risk of a government spokesman mike omeri told a new conference friday that boko haram representatives said during negotiations that the girls were in good analysts were cautious about the news with nigerian officials reporting countless false dawns in its long confrontation with the militant group and with nigeria facing presidential and parliamentary elections in jonathan is expected to announce in coming weeks that he will run for a second there have been several efforts in recent years to negotiate peace with boko haram which has battled the army for control of northern nigeria and sought to impose a strict form of islam in the none of the attempts has come to jonathan desperately in need of some good news has faced harsh criticism over his slow response to the his supporters accuse the campaign of being opposition stooges using the fate for political hundreds more women and girls have been abducted by boko haram in recent years and dozens of schoolboys and teachers were killed by the group that opposes secular education and other aspects of western but the mass kidnapping in april and the bringbackourgirls hashtag coined by nigerian activists attracted global attention to the the schoolgirls had gathered at a lightly guarded boarding school on the outskirts of the town of chibok for their final exams when the attack gunmen loaded 276 girls into trucks and drove parents and local officials accused military of failing to pursue and recover the according to nigerian officials 57 escaped and 219 remain in boko haram leader abubakar shekau later released a video describing the girls as slaves and threatening to them in the a video of the girls reciting the koran and dressed in islamic clothing was also nigeria a country of 170 million is roughly divided between the north which is predominantly muslim and the mostly christian boko haram emerged over a decade ago in response to corrupt ruling class and opposes what it sees as the taint of western influences such as taxation democracy and automatic teller it has become increasingly fragmented in recent years with some factions opposed to the violent attacks on boko assaults initially focused on police stations and military in recent years the group has stepped up its violence killing thousands of people in attacks on villages churches schools markets video entertainment venues bus stations and other crowded public

is one of the most annoying aspects of modern air travel kicking off shoes and removing belts to get through security without setting off the one frustrated traveller clearly decided the only answer was to strip off altogether much to the surprise of security the incident at pulkovo airport in st petersburg russia saw the man strip his clothes off in a nonchalant manner before strolling through the metal detector watch by bemused airport two guards can be seen chatting and looking on as the man bends down to remove his shoes and then starts to remove his suddenly the man who some sources believe may be an it department worker at the airport takes off his trousers altogether an places them in the tray with the rest of his one security worker can be seen nudging his colleague and pointing to the man but neither appears to know what to do at first all seems as normal as the man bends down to remove his shoes a common request by security when passing through metal detectors at suddenly the man surprises staff by removing his trousers altogether and placing them in a as startled workers look on seemingly unsure what to do the man continues stripping unbothered by the attention the man moves onto his top half and whips off his jumper leaving him completely but he still takes a moment to remove the wrist watch the one thing that actually could set off the scanner before strutting through the metal detecting staff stand back and appear to let him just walk through the metal the cheeky man even jokingly hesitate by the workers as if to check they want to search him completely unbothered by the attention the man then strolls through the security gate even pausing by security staff as if to ask if he needs to be searched the first thing the man puts back on is his wrist watch as he gathers his clothing up at the end of the conveyor then as if there is nothing unusual about the situation the man picks up his clothes places his wrist watch back on first then proceeds to walk st petersburg police are said to be investigating the passengers at airports around the world have long complained of searches at security points with american passengers in particular complaining about the methods of the transport security administration and instead of hurriedly getting changed the man simply bundles up his clothes and walks it seems this gentleman the first to stage a naked protest in 2013 lady kelly 51 and ann chadwick 48 stripped off at manchester airport security after sharing a bottle of the two were later sentenced for public order

on devices and programs as evidenced by recently discovered job postings but will take a more mainstream approach for the first generation instead of focusing exclusively on health and fitness the december a site called published a piece under the sensational seven primary school students pregnant after presumably refers to according to the article the ministry run by national coordinator for reproductive health nenad babici is the only source the article uses for the the original article has now been linked by the new york post the london daily mail the new york daily news courier mail newser cosmopolitan uk and several none have performed any to confirm the original one newspaper though added details to the story that were never but getting ahead of start with the underlying original even in bosnia such a culturally incendiary story should have resulted in local politicians and jumping in front of a camera and copious of the front none of this is the only source referenced at all in the story is babici and his claim that it but notably he is not quoted as saying it happened he is the remainder of the article does include a direct quote from him but the quote refer to the it instead pushes what is likely a top agenda of his ministry which is that teenage sexual activity can have other health consequences and that curbing teen sex is the responsibility of both the parent and the national coordinator for reproductive health of the republika srpska nenad babici said that children engage in sexual relations as early as at age of 13 or 14 and added that primary school students from a small town in bosnia and herzegovina went to a trip and after some time it turned out that seven schoolgirls got pregnant on he said that the reason for this was neglect of parents but also educational institutions toward the education of babic said that early engagement in sexual relations later leads to a series of consequences such as infertility various diseases miscarriages and premature the republika srpska between 15 to 18 percent of people are struggling with infertility we have 15 percent of miscarriages and between 5 to 10 percent premature he only last year according to the clinical center of the university in sarajevo 31 minors gave birth four of them are 15 years old ten are 16 years old and 17 are 17 years look at that last if a city the size of sarajevo only recorded 31 instances of teenage births last year then sarajevo have a teen pregnancy problem unless the rate of teen pregnancies that are aborted is meanwhile this story claims the girls were visiting sarajevo from small town in bosnia and called banja it is not at all clear as to what population that is drawn beyond the shortcomings of the article itself how likely is the statistics on the percentages of unprotected sexual encounters that result in pregnancy are not wonderful for obvious this study referenced in this bbc article puts the figure at about 5 percent except for the short window prior to ovulation during which the study estimates the odds at 25 so either the seven children were ovulating at the same time and had about four encounters each or they each had closer to 20 encounters over the five or all 28 students were active and about to every scenario presented by this article seems absurdly improbable from the incident itself to the manner of the to a media searching for a scoop this is where we are expected to either get to work debunking the article or to stay so how did our brethren at the start of the post i mentioned that the original are not allowed at the how collins got that information whether through his own sources or espn itself was never shared with esquire nevertheless the theme kept coming back throughout his piece as a tentpole of the existence of 11 men domestic violence panel and the anger towards it spread slowly throughout the deadspin has a nice recap of how far the story reached as it was noticed on twitter and reblogged across the internet with one feminist organization even putting the network on blast based on the esquire article in a press of course espn is not having an 11 man domestic violence panel the network has explicitly and publicly called the esquire story false as documented but just examining this story from the outset there was plenty to be skeptical about in first of all espn has covered domestic violence and the nfl at length while involving women in the jane mcmanus has been a consistent presence on espn airwaves and espn has a deep bench of female commentators that have talked about the issue on the you can criticize sports networks for not involving women in more prominent ways but espn at least appears to be trying to make an effort mcmanus defended the network on second in light of those tweets no mention of suzy kolber who will be one of the hosts on monday night countdown if any panel discussion happening tonight she be third easy to make fun of espn and the gratuitously absurd amount of nfl analysts the network but who in their right mind would conduct an 11 person panel on a topic like domestic not something that even nancy grace and the cable news networks would be silly enough to if to believe this esquire story chris berman would be moderating an 11 person panel discussion on domestic violence including everyone from the game announcers to not even espn would be that bristol began the the network released their coverage plans for monday night countdown and in a move straight out of the espn pr playbook they also highlighted contributions to their coverage of the nfl domestic violence a rare public statement from john wildhack one of the highest on the espn executive food chain also disputed the esquire contrary to published reports in esquire there was no panel on domestic violence ever planned for monday night we will present our normal monday night football show with suzy kolber espn is proud of the work it has done covering the issue of domestic violence and is committed to continued much of that work has been informed by several talented female colleagues from our television and espnw platforms including hannah storm jemele hill jane mcmanus kate fagan sarah spain and so how did this haphazard and reckless writing at esquire gradually began to be taken as there never were plans for an 11 men panel to discuss domestic violence on monday night collins merely listed the talent that would be working the show and assumed the topic would come up at some point during the evening in an unbelievable failure in communication through the written collins explained his position in greater detail on his twitter a pretty far cry from what collins actually wrote in his article which made it abundantly clear there would be a special domestic violence panel with enough men to field an entire football to 11 men all between the ages of 39 and 74 will sit at the table for a domestic violence discussion on no ambiguity in that 100 out of 100 people would read that sentence and think espn would be televising a large panel discussion specifically focused on domestic violence how does someone who is a news editor at a major publication blur the lines of truth and fiction so had collins stuck with that last tweet he would have had the basis for a decent column and a valid criticism worth but because of the overall sloppiness of the esquire piece that point was missed instead a lot of people have wasted a lot of time talking about an 11 men domestic violence panel that never

celebrates wider range of identities and protects young women from sexual elon elon university has dropped the term from its vocabulary and replaced it with a move made official this fall and implemented in everything from its website to orientation the change at the small private liberal arts college in north carolina was done to promote inclusivity celebrate diversity and ensure the campus did not promote sexist stereotypes or create a hostile and unsafe environment for female students campus officials said in interviews with the college royster director of community said in an email to the college fix that she has been told by some that they believe the term is outdated and that replacing with is a of royster stated the word naturally insinuates a hierarchy among students on she said she believes that students are viewed as younger and less experienced when referred to as with that royster stated may contribute to sexual violence on campus because it labels the youngest students causing them to be term has often been felt to refer to the vulnerableness of young women in college for the first royster the rates of sexual violence perpetrated against women on college campuses it is useful to examine any use of a term that suggests that a group of people just entering college might be targets for such violence in any royster said she believes this change will positively impact future students at elon and foster progress in inclusivity related to language that allows for a more inclusive understanding of gender will be important in our culture moving she away from language including pronouns that denote a gender binary will be something we see more and more as our culture evolves to celebrate a wider range of identities and at this student orientation leader training administrators made it clear that incoming students must be called no public announcement was made regarding this change administrators relied largely on word of mouth to carry the elon sophomore alaina schukraft an orientation leader told the fix that each time an orientation leader said in training he or she was immediately engrained over and over in our brains that it was supposed to be not schukraft were very adamant about using the correct terminology and stressed the importance of using language that would make the new students feel but when the new wording was rolled out not all incoming students were comfortable with this schukraft said multiple incoming students approached her saying they were more comfortable with the term but greg zaiser vice president of admissions and financial planning said in an email to the college fix that the change improves the campus zaiser said administrators believe the change keeps with core values and is a more appropriate description for new he added some believe is a term and elon is attempting to move away from gendered an inclusive community elon strives to incorporate language that is current and reflective of our student zaiser said in an email to the college necessarily wrong but not completely applicable to entire population which includes internationals transfers spring admits along with traditional students beginning their first year on a college college fix contributor diana stancy is a student at elon university and president of the network of enlightened women chapter at like the
